alert.note: Alert for Cottle; Crosby; Dickens; Motley (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 01 at 9:01PM CST until January 02 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST SUNDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 5 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. * WHERE...Cottle, Crosby, Dickens and Motley Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 6 AM CST Sunday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until Midnight CST tonight. * IMPACTS...Frostbite and hypothermia are possible if precautions are not taken. Wind chill values may fall to extremely dangerous levels. Plan on slippery road conditions. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Keep pets indoors as much as possible. Make frequent checks on older family, friends, and neighbors. Ensure portable heaters are used correctly. Do not use generators or grills inside. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
